intro: Endiandra crassiflora, commonly known as the thick-flowered endiandra, is a tropical evergreen tree native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae and is characterized by its dense, leathery leaves and showy, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows in lowland rainforests and thrives in humid, shaded environments. Its flowers, which are usually pink or white, attract various pollinators such as bees and birds. Due to its ornamental value and ecological importance, it is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens and conservation programs.
